title: How To Train Your FAMILY MILK COW | Milking Cows 101

tasks.task: Prepare a stanchion for a cow named Allie.
subtasks: Bolt a cross bar into the stanchion.
Install a two by four to secure Allie's rear end.
Secure a chain to prevent Allie from moving.
Train Allie to stay within the stanchion using cattle-handling techniques.
Administer apple cider vinegar spray as a part of the milking process.
Integrate calf halter to encourage milk letdown.

tasks.task: Beef up the stanchion for a more assertive cow.
subtasks: Reinforce the existing stanchion with additional two by fours.
Hang a heavy clamp to secure the stanchion's chain.
Restrict Allie's movement by closing the V-stanchion.

tasks.task: Conduct stanchion training for a cow named Allie.
subtasks: Comfort and desensitize Allie to being touched.
Give commands for moving her legs.
Familiarize Allie with the stanchion for future milking.

tasks.task: The video mentions using a stanchion for a cow named Allie. The first thing they do is install a cross bar to pull her closer. Then, they talk about bolting on a side hook and a chain. So first task would be setting up the stanchion, with subtasks like bolting in cross bars, attaching chains, etc. But wait, is the stanchion being rebuilt? The person says, "beef this up that way it is ready for her to go buck wild," so maybe they are enhancing an existing structure. But maybe the original stanchion wasn't very secure, leading to the need for improvements. So MAINTASK: Prepare a stanchion for a cow named Allie.
Conduct stanchion training for a cow named Allie.
Beef up the stanchion for a more assertive cow.
